title: Marketplace Tech for Friday, February 27, 2015
description: Airing on Friday, Feb. 27, 2015: The FCC has approved new internet rules, ushering in net neutrality. First up is Susan Crawford, Co-Director of the Berkman Center for Internet and Society, to talk about the FCC's vote on Thursday. Next we take a look at why only a third of people in the U.S. have chip and pin credit cards - a system widely used in other countries. And, for this week's Silicon Tally, we are joined by Leo Laporte, host of the podcast, "This Week in Tech."
